quoteFirst: Having now a good salmon, for this water, in the boat, and a grilse or two, and it being
quoteLast: , overcast, and with a dark bit of the forest to walk through to the road, I signified my intention of going home; but Knut's blue eyes opened wide in surprise and pleading, and he besought me to have one more trial.  As the young fellow had been working hard for three hours, and this was uncommonly good of him, I consented, and, keeping on the same fly, we began half-way up the pool, my intention being only to fish the tail end.
title: Lines in Pleasant Places: Being the Aftermath of an Old Angler

quoteFirst: Happy was Patsey's little flock of scholars. Every morning, at

quoteFirst: Would it be victory or defeat? In the strength of her new-born spirit France was ready for either fate. The streets of Paris were darkened; the theatres were shut up; the cafés were ordered to close
